attributes.action: Keep gyms open in national lockdown ls based on the data that they are safe
attributes.additional_details: Because people’s daily lives, health and fitness rely on it, a gym has incomparable value to a walk or jog from your home, it provides people with a chance to improve them selves both physically and mentally and have a hobbie they are passionate about, gyms will take the strain off the nhs. The current obesity pandemic levels and suicide rates are increasing more so than the coronavirus and no vaccine or lockdown can stop these only self prescribed exercise in a gym, think if the bigger picture.
attributes.background: Following the new national lockdown allow gyms to stay open (with the current COVID secure measures in place) for the country’s physical and mental health, considering the increasing levels of obesity and suicides from closed gyms and lockdowns which no vaccine can fix, only gym based exercise

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons
